Art. 4.47. 
Withdrawal of renunciation 
As long as the right to accept has not become time-barred against successors who have renounced, they may still accept the succession, if it has not already been accepted by other heirs; without prejudice, however, to rights which may be acquired by third parties over the property of the succession, either by prescription or by acts validly performed with the curator of the vacant succession.
